info.name: Out of Pocket
info.attribution:
Implementation and art by Mitchell Stolycia.

All artwork, including the library image and wheels, is released under CC BY 4.0. Everything else is released under CC0.

Thank you to mousewax for scripting contributions and assistance.

The audio file Ponderous.ogg by akx is used to alert the active player of their turn and is available under CC0 at https://github.com/akx/Notifications/.
info.description: Stave off becoming bakrupt in a race against time.
info.similarAwards:
2016 Cardboard Republic Daredevil Laurel Nominee
2015 Meeples Choice Award Nominee
info.helpText:
Setup
Make sure everyone is seated by clicking on a seat, then click Setup.
References
References are available at the centre left and right of the table.
Adjusting your available money
Adjust your money accordingly using the - and + buttons nearby your seat. Integers greater than 0 should always be used for either button.
Company cards
These are played into your coloured holder in the centre of the table.
Funds
Play to the appropriate time slot on your wheel.
Throughout Phase 1 of a round, click End turn after you have taken your company cards, funds, or passed. The next player will now be highlighted to proceed with their action.

Trading
  1. On your turn click the Offer [player name] button for who you would like to make a trade with.
  2. Within the pop-up, click on a company card that both you and the other player owns. Type an amount of money you would like to offer.
  3. The player receiving the offer will have the square next to their seat change colour and value to represent the offer you have made.
  4. The receiving player must now click Accept or Reject & pay. In either case, a card and money will be exchanged automatically.
  5. After trading, click End turn.
Purchasing VPs
Take the black VP card you would like in front of you and adjust your money accordingly using the - and + buttons.
Phase 3
Click the Player 1 button to set a new first player. The new first player now discards a funds card from the market to the discard pile. The first player's name will be written on the Player 1 button for reference.
Advancing time
Click on your wheel to advance time by one step. If there was a market crash, click your wheel twice.
Throughout the game, make sure everyone's wheel is pointing in the same direction.
